meanings.sent1: The forest was the snaggiest I had ever seen, with fallen trees blocking every path.
meanings.sent2: The mountain trail was the snaggiest route we had attempted, making progress slow and challenging.
meanings.sent3: Trying to walk through the snaggiest part of the park felt like a never-ending maze of branches and roots.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was the snaggiest puzzle, full of twists and turns that were hard to unravel.
meanings.sent5: The snaggiest section of the river was where the fallen logs created a chaotic obstacle course for kayakers.

meanings.definition: Most difficult or challenging to navigate
meanings.sent1: The maze was the snaggiest puzzle I had ever attempted to solve.
meanings.sent2: The final exam was the snaggiest test of the semester, requiring hours of intense studying.
meanings.sent3: Her schedule for the day was the snaggiest, with back-to-back meetings and deadlines to meet.
meanings.sent4: The negotiation process was the snaggiest road to agreement, with both parties unwilling to compromise.
meanings.sent5: The snaggiest part of the journey was the steep, rocky terrain that tested their endurance and determination.

meanings.definition: Full of snags or sharp projections
meanings.sent1: The old fence was the snaggiest, with rusty nails sticking out at odd angles.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned building was the snaggiest structure in town, with broken glass and jagged edges.
meanings.sent3: His jacket was the snaggiest piece of clothing, with threads hanging loose and catching on everything.
meanings.sent4: The thorny bush was the snaggiest plant in the garden, making it difficult to prune.
meanings.sent5: The snaggiest part of the trail was where the overgrown bushes reached out with sharp branches, snagging hikers' clothes.
